column2: Description
Get the seafood. Get the seafood. Get the damn seafood. Got it?
Late night billiards and drinks. Of course.
All about sustainable seafood. Ingenuity over deliciousness. A bit pricey, but worth it. SCIENCE.
Steakhouse. Seafood. Pricey. Fancy.
Cocktails! Cocktails! More cocktails! Not deserted like other places.
Single cup brew bar. Assorted pastries and goodies. Saturday night entertainment.
Best almond croissant ever? Macarons found here. Best? Not sure.
Pie-in-the-sky.
I really hope you don’t need a description to understand what’s going on here. “House special” = heated cinnamon roll with melted butter on top.
A bit inland. But sexy, sexy, oh so sexy cheesecake. 14 reviews. 5 full-on sexy stars.
Super solid brunch in Pacific Grove.
The best Mexican in Pacific Grove.
Fresh seafood. Again.
Mixed reviews on some French classics/pastries. "Pastry was great!" "Beef bourguignon sucked balls."
Killer Mediterranean in Carmel.
Cigars, and...chess? How quintessentially English. One pataeto, two pataeto? you alwright?
Description
Hawaiian Food. Good Happy Hour. Stiff cocktails. That's what she said. Apparently lots of fun. Relaxed.
Go on Saturdays. Ask for Emily the bartender. She will take care of you.
Mixed reviews about ambiance, cocktails, and an extensively confusing menu.
Description
The most beautiful state park in the universe. Debatable. But noted.

column1: Best Trails: North Shore Trail, Cypress Grove Trail, China Cove
column2: Excercise that shit, bro.
Be-you-tee-full Beach. Quiet. Serene. Search "Carmel Beach," not "Carmel State Beach," cause the latter is fuglies, relative.
Pebble Beach Stops are gorgeous. 10 bucks though. Some say it's "grand," not "beautiful." "L.A veterans who've seen good beaches need not apply."
“Outstanding. Impressed. Broad scope. Love the variety. New salt exhibit by a young Japanese artist, around until August 25th.” *Ehhhhhhhhhhhh-not-bad-face*
Best clam chowda’. Maybe? OR...just tourist hype? Beware! Dense tourist attraction area. (“MOVE BITCH. GET OUTTA THE WAY!” or “JUST SHUT UP. YOU’RE SO UGLY!”)

“Carmel is known for more than just its charm, but also its quirky laws. For one, you're prohibited from eating ice cream on the sidewalk. (ANGRY FACE. It’s k. Your ice cream sucks anyway.). “And ladies beware: You need a permit to walk in high-heeled shoes.” (because the gravel...is softer than...normal?) -_- Time to leave, boys and girls.
Awesome for walking. Hipster art area too...secret paths and hidden trails, etc.
Just a Moto GP racing track. I don’t think any event is going on that weekend though; doesn’t seem like enough hotels are booked for that sort of thing. NEEEER NEEEER!! not really.
